result.execSummary:
The defendant Montrell L Cornell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Obtain GED. Seek and maintain employment.
Pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Court orders defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done.  Pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.
Court advises defendant he cannot possess firearms.
Court advises defendant he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montrell L Cornell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (13 pages) commencing SENTENCING HEARING JUNE 16, 2014 received and filed.CB

Defendant Montrel L Cornell in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Montrel L Cornell in custody.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 4 years with 54 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 2 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 2 years; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) obtain GED; 4) seek and maintain employment.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done
-  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Montrel L Cornell in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Montrel L Cornell in custody.  Karen A Loebel for Richard Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Montrel L Cornell in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Montrel L Cornell in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson for Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Original Information previously filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense requests a projected guilty plea hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 44.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Montrel L Cornell in court with attorney Gregory Renden for Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Montrel L Cornell in custody.  Denis Stingl for Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Arraignment scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Montrel L Cornell in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Montrel L Cornell in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
